content: and key pairs are hosted on the IBM z16 HMC. The following FTP server requirements must be met:  Passive data connections are supported  A server configuration is available that allows the client to connect on an ephemeral port The following FTPS server requirements must be met:  Operates in “explicit” mode  Allows a server to offer secure and unsecured connections  Supports passive data connections  Supports secure data connections The SFTP server must support password-based authentication. The file transfer server choices for HMC are shown in Figure 10-20. Figure 10-20 FTP protocol choices FTP through HMC It is recommended to keep the HMCs and SEs on an isolated network. This approach prevents SEs from starting FTP connections with outside networks. It also applies to all supported file transfer protocols (FTP, FTPS, and SFTP). Chapter 10. Hardware Management Console and Support Element 427 All FTP connections that originate from the SE are taken to the HMC. Secure FTP server
